brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of high intensity interval training on
      exercise capacity and quality of life in patients with end stage renal disease on
      hemodialysis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of High-intensity Interval Training in Patients in Hemodialysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients on hemodialysis ≥ 3 months

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute infection

          -  Systolic BP>180 mmHG or diabolic BP>105 mmHG

          -  Unstable angina pectoris

          -  Serious rhythm disturbances

          -  Hyperkalemic (> 6 mmol/L),

          -  Unstable diabetes mellitus

          -  Wheelchair

          -  Dialyses access on lower extremities

          -  Haemoglobin < 9 g/dl

intervention.description: Group A: high intensity exercise training Group B: moderate intensity exercise training C: Control group

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Norwegian Fund for Postgraduate Training in Physiotherapy
